<TYPE>EX-32
<SEQUENCE>4
<FILENAME>v446426_ex32.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 32
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
     <TITLE></TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<P STYLE="margin: 0; text-align: right"><B>Exhibit 32</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin: 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin: 0"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
center"><B>CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO </B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
center"><B>18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350, </B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
center"><B>AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO </B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
center"><B>SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT
OF 2002</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
center"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
center"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin: 0"></P>
<P STYLE="font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-
align: justify; text-indent: 0in"><FONT STYLE="font-weight: normal">In
connection with the quarterly report of Superior Drilling Products, Inc. (the 
&ldquo;Company&rdquo;) on Form 10-Q for the quarter
ended June 30, 2016 as filed with the Securities Exchange Commission on the date
hereof (the &ldquo;Report&rdquo;), G. Troy Meier,
the Chief Executive Officer of the Company, and Christopher D. Cashion,</FONT> 
<FONT STYLE="font-weight: normal">the Chief Financial
Officer of the Company, certify pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Sec. 1350, as adopted 
pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of
2002, that to their knowledge:</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-
indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in">(1)</TD><TD STYLE="text-
align: justify">The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a)
or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange
Act of 1934; and</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 45pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in">(2)</TD><TD STYLE="text-
align: justify">The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all 
material respects, the financial
condition and results of operation of the Company.</TD></TR></TABLE>

<us-gaap:NatureOfOperations contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" 
id="Factid_292">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-
SIZE: 10pt"&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
COLOR: #231f20"&gt; &lt;b&gt;Nature of Operations&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both"&gt; 
&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;We are a drilling and completion tool 
technology company. We are a designer and manufacturer of new drill bit and 
horizontal drill string enhancement tools and refurbisher of PDC 
(polycrystalline diamond compact) drill bits for the oil, natural gas and mining
services industry. Our customers are engaged in domestic and international 
exploration and production of oil and natural gas. We were incorporated on 
December 10, 2013 under the name SD Company, Inc. in order to facilitate (a) the
reorganization of the entities that are now our consolidated subsidiaries and 
(b) the subsequent acquisition of Hard Rock Solutions, LLC. We changed our name 
from SD Company Inc. to Superior Drilling Products, Inc. on May 22, 2014 in 
conjunction with closing of that reorganization and our initial public offering 
which occurred on May 23, 2014. &lt;font style="COLOR: #231f20"&gt;Our 
headquarters and principal manufacturing operations are located in Vernal, 
Utah.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;table border="0" 
style="width:100%; table-layout:fixed;" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;</us-
gaap:NatureOfOperations>
<us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" id="Factid_293">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 
0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; 
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20"&gt; &lt;b&gt;Basis of 
Presentation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times 
New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-
INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR:
#231f20" align="justify"&gt;The accompanying consolidated condensed financial 
statements of the Company include the accounts of the Company, and of its 
wholly-owned subsidiaries (a) Superior Drilling Solutions, LLC (previously known
as Superior Drilling Products, LLC), a Utah limited liability company 
(&amp;#8220;SDS&amp;#8221;), together with its wholly owned subsidiary, Superior
Design and Fabrication, LLC, a Utah limited liability company 
(&amp;#8220;SDF&amp;#8221;), (b) Extreme Technologies, LLC, a Utah limited 
liability company (&amp;#8220;ET&amp;#8221;), (c) Meier Properties Series, LLC, 
a Utah limited liability company (&amp;#8220;MPS&amp;#8221;), (d) Meier Leasing,
LLC, a Utah limited liability company (&amp;#8220;ML&amp;#8221;), and (e) Hard 
Rock Solutions, LLC, a Utah limited liability company 
(&amp;#8220;HR&amp;#8221;). These consolidated condensed financial statements 
have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted 
in the United States of America (&amp;#8220;GAAP&amp;#8221;), and all 
significant intercompany accounts have been eliminated in 
consolidation.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-
INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR:
#231f20" align="justify"&gt;As a company with less than $&lt;font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1.0&lt;/font&gt; billion 
in revenue during its last fiscal year, which completed its initial public 
offering after December 2011, we qualify as an emerging growth company as 
defined in the Jumpstart Our Business Startups Act of 2012, or the JOBS Act. An 
emerging growth company may take advantage of exemptions from various reporting 
requirements applicable to other public companies that are not an 
&amp;#8220;emerging growth company.&amp;#8221;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;table
border="0" style="width:100%; table-layout:fixed;" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;</us-

contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" id="Factid_294">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt

&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 
0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20"&gt; 
&lt;b&gt;Unaudited Interim Financial Information&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20" 
align="justify"&gt;These interim consolidated condensed financial statements for
the three and six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, and the related footnote 
disclosures included herein, are unaudited. However, in the opinion of 
management, these unaudited interim financial statements have been prepared on 
the same basis as the audited financial statements, and reflect all adjustments 
necessary to fairly state the results for such periods. The results of 
operations for the three and six months ended June 30, 2016 are not necessarily 
indicative of the results of operations expected for the year ended December 31,
2016. These interim consolidated condensed financial statements should be read 
in conjunction with the audited consolidated financial statements of the Company
for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 and the notes thereto, which were
included in the Company&amp;#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year 
ended December 31, 2015, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the 
&amp;#8220;SEC&amp;#8221;).&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;table border="0"

<us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" 
id="Factid_295">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-
SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both"&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt; &lt;b&gt;Basic and Diluted Earnings Per 
Share&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-
INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" 
align="justify"&gt;Basic earnings per common share is computed by dividing net 
income by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the 
period. Diluted earnings per share is calculated to give effect to potentially 
issuable common shares, which include stock warrants. As of June 30, 2016, the 
Company had warrants exercisable for &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 714,286&lt;/font&gt; shares of common stock
at $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;4.00&lt;/font&gt; per share. These warrants have a four year term 
expiring in &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt; February 2018&lt;/font&gt;. These warrants were anti-dilutive for the 
three and six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20" 
align="justify"&gt;During the month of March 2016, the Board of Directors 
granted options to acquire &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 309,133&lt;/font&gt; shares of stock from 
the Company&amp;#8217;s 2015 Long Term Incentive Plan to directors, officers and
employees. All options were anti-dilutive for earnings per share for the three 
and six months ended June 30, 2016.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;table border="0"
style="width:100%; table-layout:fixed;" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;</us-
gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
<sdpi:RentalIncomePolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" 
id="Factid_296">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-
SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt; &lt;b&gt;Rental and Sales Income&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20" align="justify"&gt;The
Company operates as a drilling and completion tool technology company that rents
drill string enhancement tools and sells tools in the completion and workover 
industry all for use by customers engaged in the oil and gas business. While the
duration of the rents vary by job and number of runs, these rents are generally 
less than one month. The rental agreements do not have minimum rental payments 
or terms. Revenue is recognized upon completion of the job. The tools are 
currently rented and sold primarily to entities operating in North Dakota, 
Wyoming, Texas, Montana, Oklahoma, Utah, New Mexico and Colorado.&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;table border="0" style="width:100%; table-layout:fixed;" 
cellspacing="0"
cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;</sdp
i:RentalIncomePolicyPolicyTextBlock>
<us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" 
id="Factid_297">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-
SIZE: 10pt"&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt; &lt;b&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;The Company 
recognizes an asset or liability for the deferred tax consequences of all 
temporary differences between the tax basis of assets or liabilities and their 
reported amounts in the financial statements that will result in taxable or 
deductible amounts in future years when the reported amounts of the asset or 
liabilities are recovered or settled and for operating loss carry forwards. 
These deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured using the enacted tax 
rates that will be in effect when the differences are expected to reverse and 
the carry forwards are expected to be realized. As of June 30, 2016, a full 
valuation allowance has been applied to the Company&amp;#8217;s deferred tax 
assets.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;table border="0" style="width:100%; table-
layout:fixed;" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;</us-
gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
<us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityInterestRateDescription 
contextRef="P03_01_2016To03_08_2016" id="Factid_298">This note has a variable 
interest rate of prime plus 1% plus a monthly service fee of 0.48% of the 
current outstanding balance on the note.</us-
gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityInterestRateDescription>
<sdpi:LiquidityPolicyTextBlock contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" 
id="Factid_299">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-
SIZE: 10pt"&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
COLOR: #231f20"&gt; &lt;b&gt;Liquidity&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 31.7pt; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;At June 30, 2016, 
we had negative working capital of approximately $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;4.4&lt;/font&gt; million. During 
2015 and into 2016, our principal sources of liquidity were cash flow from 
operations and our new credit facility with Federal National Commercial Credit 
(&amp;#8220;FNCC&amp;#8221;). Our principal uses of cash are operating expenses,
working capital requirements, capital expenditures and debt service payments. 
Given the current environment of the oil and gas industry, our revenue has 
dramatically declined in 2015 and 2016.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; 
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0in; FONT: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;On August 5,
2016, we completed the Bridge Financing to provide us with liquidity for the 
next several months (see Note 9 &amp;#150; Recent Developments). Our operational
and financial strategies include lowering our operating costs and capital 
spending to match revenue trends, managing our working capital and managing our 
debt to enhance liquidity. For example, to conserve cash, we implemented a 
salary for stock options program during the first quarter of 2016 for senior 
management and our board of directors.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; 
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.44in; MARGIN: 0in;
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0in; FONT: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;On March 8, 
2016, we entered into a $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif';
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;3&lt;/font&gt; million financing agreement with FNCC. The 
financing agreement includes a $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;500,000&lt;/font&gt; term loan 
collateralized with previously unencumbered manufacturing equipment and a 
$&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;2.5&lt;/font&gt; million accounts receivable revolving credit facility 
allowing up to &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 85&lt;/font&gt;% of eligible accounts receivable (see Note 5 
&amp;#150; Long Term Debt). As of June 30, 2016, we were not in compliance with 
all financial covenants under the FNCC facility and we are currently in 
discussions with them to amend the terms of the debt.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.44in; MARGIN: 0in; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;On 
August 10, 2016, certain of our subsidiaries entered into an amended and 
restated note with the seller in our acquisition of Hard Rock Solutions, LLC (as
so amended and restated, the &amp;#8220;Hard Rock Note&amp;#8221;). As amended 
and restated effective August 10, 2016, the Hard Rock Note accrues interest at 
&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 
5.75&lt;/font&gt;% per annum and matures and is fully payable on January 15, 
2020. Under the current terms of Hard Rock Note, we are required to make the 
following payments: payments of $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1,500,000&lt;/font&gt; (plus accrued 
interest) on or before October 15, 2016, accrued interest on each of January 15,
March 15, May 15 and July 15, 2017, $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;500,000&lt;/font&gt; (plus accrued interest)
on each of January 15, March 15, May 15 and July 15, 2018, and $&lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;1,000,000&lt;/font&gt; (plus accrued interest) on each of January 15, 
March 15, May 15 and July 15, 2019, with the remaining balance of principal and 
accrued interest on the Hard Rock Note due on January 15, 2020.&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 
0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; 
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px;
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;In 
connection with the amendment and restatement, we made an interest payment of 
approximately $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt"&gt;304,000&lt;/font&gt; on the Hard Rock Note. In addition, 
we&amp;#160;issued &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 700,000&lt;/font&gt; restricted shares of common stock (having 
an agreed per share value of $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1.43&lt;/font&gt;, or $&lt;font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1,000,000&lt;/font&gt; in
the aggregate) as payment for $1,000,000 of the $1,500,000 due on the Hard Rock 
Note on or before October 15, 2016. Interest will continue to accrue on the Hard
Rock Note based on the $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1,000,000&lt;/font&gt; value of the shares until such shares
are registered.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20; 
CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;During 2016, we plan on using the cash flows 
from operations to service our debt obligations, including the Bridge Financing,
the Hard Rock Note, our FNCC indebtedness and other financing debt, real 
property leases and equipment loans (see Note 9 &amp;#150; Recent Developments).
&lt;font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt;FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;Based on current forecasts, we will need to restructure debt 
obligations, including with Hard Rock and FNCC, as well as raise additional 
capital through equity and/or debt financings. We cannot provide any assurance 
that financing will be available to us in the future on acceptable 
terms.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both"&gt; &amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.44in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;If we cannot raise required funds on acceptable 
terms, we may not be able to, among other things, (i) maintain our current 
general and administrative spending levels; (ii) fund certain obligations as 
they become due; and (iii) respond to competitive pressures or unanticipated 
capital requirements. This will require us to find additional avenues to 
decrease spending which may hinder our ability to effectively compete in the 
current oil and gas market.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;table border="0" 
style="width:100%; table-layout:fixed;" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;</sdp
i:LiquidityPolicyTextBlock>
<us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" id="Factid_300">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 
0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; 
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt; &lt;b&gt;Accounting 
Standards&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both"&gt; &amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: 
#231f20" align="justify"&gt;In April 2015, FASB issued an accounting standards 
update for &amp;#8220;Interest &amp;#150; Imputation of Interest,&amp;#8221; 
which simplifies the presentation of debt issuance costs. This accounting 
standard update requires that debt issuance cost related to a recognized debt 
liability be presented in the balance sheet as a direct deduction from the 
carrying amount of that debt liability, consistent with debt discounts. The new 
update if effective for financial statements issued for fiscal years beginning 
after December 15, 2015 (and interim periods within those fiscal years). The 
adoption of this new accounting standard update resulted in a reclassification 
of debt issuance costs from Other assets to Line of Credit, net and Long term 
debt, net. See Note 5 &amp;#8220;Long-Term Debt&amp;#8221; for disclosure of 
debt issuance costs. Adoption of this accounting standard update did not impact 
our statements of operations or cash flows.&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;table border="0" style="width:100%; table-layout:fixed;" 
cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;</us-
gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>

#231f20" align="justify"&gt;Amortization expense related to intangible assets 
for the three and six months ended June 30, 2016, was $&lt;font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;611,667&lt;/font&gt; and 
$&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;1,223,333&lt;/font&gt;, respectively, and for the three and six months 
ended June 30, 2015, was $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;617,536&lt;/font&gt; and $&lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;1,223,333&lt;/font&gt;, respectively.&lt;/div&gt; 
&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;Annually, and more often as necessary, 
we will perform an evaluation of our intangible assets for indications of 
impairment. If indications exist, we will perform an evaluation of the fair 
value of the intangible assets and, if necessary, record an impairment charge. 
As of June 30, 2016, the Company reviewed the net balance of the intangible 
assets and determined no impairment was needed.&lt;/div&gt;

cellspacing="0"

<us-gaap:DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock 
contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" id="Factid_304">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 
0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; 
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20"&gt; &lt;strong&gt;NOTE 8. SHARE BASED 
COMPENSATION&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; &amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" 
align="justify"&gt;On June 15, 2015, our stockholders approved the Superior 
Drilling Company, Inc. 2015 Long Term Incentive Plan (the &amp;#8220;2015 
Incentive Plan&amp;#8221;). The purpose of the 2015 Incentive Plan is to advance
the interests of the Company and its stockholders by providing an incentive to 
attract, retain and reward persons performing services for the Company and its 
affiliates and by motivating such persons to contribute to the growth and 
profitability of the Company and our affiliates. Subject to adjustment as
provided in the 2015 Incentive Plan, the maximum aggregate number of shares of 
the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock that may be issued with respect to awards 
under the 2015 Incentive Plan is &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 1,592,878&lt;/font&gt;.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20" align="justify"&gt;On 
March 4, 2016, the Board of Directors granted options to acquire &lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 
78,944&lt;/font&gt; shares of stock from the Company&amp;#8217;s 2015 Incentive 
Plan to officers and employees based on the closing price of the 
Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of the grant, which was $&lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;1.73&lt;/font&gt;. These options vested &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 100&lt;/font&gt;% on the grant 
date and have a ten year term expiring on &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;March 4, 2026&lt;/font&gt;. The fair 
value of the vested stock options were calculated using the Black-Scholes model 
with a volatility and discount rate over the expected term of each 
employee.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: 
#231f20" align="justify"&gt;On March 18, 2016, the Board of Directors granted 
options to acquire &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 81,714&lt;/font&gt; shares of stock from the Company&amp;#8217;s
2015 Incentive Plan to officers and employees based on the closing price of the 
Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of the grant, which was $&lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;1.67&lt;/font&gt;. These options vested &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 100&lt;/font&gt;% on the grant 
date and have a ten year term expiring on &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;March 18, 2026&lt;/font&gt;. The fair 
value of the vested stock options were calculated using the Black-Scholes model 
with a volatility and discount rate over the expected term of each 
employee.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: 
#231f20" align="justify"&gt;On March 31, 2016, the Board of Directors granted 
options to acquire &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 148,475&lt;/font&gt; shares of stock from the 
Company&amp;#8217;s 2015 Incentive Plan to directors, officers and employees 
based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date 
of the grant, which was $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif';
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1.37&lt;/font&gt;. These options vested &lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 
100&lt;/font&gt;% on the grant date and have a ten-year term expiring on 
&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;March 31, 2026&lt;/font&gt;. The fair value of the vested stock options
were calculated using the Black-Scholes model with a volatility and discount 
rate over the expected term of each employee.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 
&lt;/font&gt;The fair value of stock options granted to employees and directors 
was estimated at the grant date using the Black-Scholes option pricing model
using the following assumptions:&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt"

then 0.35 for September 30 and October 31, 2016, and then 1.00 for November 30, 
2016 and each month thereafter; (b) Debt-to-Tangible Net Worth of not greater 
than 4.35 tested monthly from June 30 through August 31, 2016 and then 4.25 for 
September 30, 2016 and each month thereafter; and (c) Liquid Ratio of at least 
0.325 tested monthly from June 30 through September 30, 2016 and then 0.40 for

<us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" id="Factid_307">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 
0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; 
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20"&gt; &lt;b&gt;NOTE 6. COMMITMENTS AND 
CONTINGENCIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times
New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; &amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both;
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px;
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="COLOR: #231f20"&gt;We are subject to litigation that arises from time to 
time in the ordinary course of our business activities. We are not currently 
involved in any litigation which management believes could have a material 
effect on&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style="COLOR: #231f20"&gt;our financial position
or results of operations, except as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="COLOR: #231f20"&gt;In October 2013, Del-Rio Resources, Inc. 
(&amp;#8220;Del-Rio&amp;#8221;) filed suit, on its own behalf and derivatively 
on behalf of Philco Exploration, LLC (&amp;#8220;Philco&amp;#8221;), against the
following co-defendants (a) Tronco Ohio, LLC and Tronco, (b) the lender on the 
Tronco loan, ACF Property Management, Inc. (p.k.a. Fortuna Asset Management, 
LLC, ) (&amp;#8220;ACF&amp;#8221;), (c) Troy and Annette Meier personally, and 
several of their family trusts, (d) Meier Family Holding Company, LLC and Meier 
Management Company, LLC, and (e) SDS and MPS. That suit is currently pending in 
the Eighth Judicial District Court, Uintah County, Utah under&lt;/font&gt; 
&lt;font style="COLOR: #231f20"&gt;Cause #130800125.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px;
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="COLOR: #231f20"&gt;Tronco and Del-Rio are the sole owners and managers of
Philco. Philco served as the exploration operator. Part of the collateral for 
the Tronco loan is Philco&amp;#8217;s mineral leases. Del- Rio&amp;#8217;s suit 
alleges that the defendants made amendments to the Tronco loan without complying
with the&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style="COLOR: #231f20"&gt;voting provisions of 
Philco&amp;#8217;s operating agreement, and that all of the Meier-related 
entities somehow benefitted from the Tronco loan proceeds, in an unspecified 
manner. Del-Rio&amp;#8217;s suit seeks to invalidate ACF&amp;#8217;s deeds of 
trust on the Philco mineral leases, and to acquire title to those Philco mineral
leases. ACF no longer has deeds of trust of any of the Philco mineral leases. 
Del Rio is also requesting monetary and punitive damages, disgorgement, 
prejudgment interest, post judgment interest, costs, and attorney fees, against 
all defendants, in an amount to be determined at trial.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20" align="justify"&gt;We 
believe that Del-Rio&amp;#8217;s claims are without merit, and all defendants 
are actively defending in this matter. In particular, SDS&amp;#8217; and 
MPS&amp;#8217; only involvement was to grant guaranties and/or security 
interests in their respective separate personal and real property to ACF to 
additionally collateralize the Tronco loan before its purchase by us. In 
addition, since the Meiers&amp;#8217; and their personal trusts guaranty 
repayment of the Tronco loan, we believe that the basis of Del-Rio&amp;#8217;s 
damages claims are nullified. Consequently, we do not believe that Del 
Rio&amp;#8217;s purported claims against SDS and MPS will have any material 
adverse effect on our cash flow, business, or operations. As of June 30, 2016, 
there have been no updates or decisions made concerning this matter.&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;table border="0" style="width:100%; table-layout:fixed;" 
cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;</us-
gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
<us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" id="Factid_308">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 
0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; 
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20"&gt; &lt;b&gt;NOTE 7. RELATED PARTY 
TRANSACTIONS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times 
New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both"&gt; &amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" 
align="justify"&gt;On January 1, 2016, the Company completed the divestiture of 
our interest in Superior Auto Body and Paint (&amp;#8220;SAB&amp;#8221;), by 
selling the remaining ownership interests in the business operations to a third 
party. The Company hired an independent third party evaluation firm to determine
the value of the operations of SAB. The Firm determined the value was $&lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;101,400&lt;/font&gt; for the portion owned by the Company. The Company 
received $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;50,700&lt;/font&gt; in cash and a note receivable for $&lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;50,700&lt;/font&gt;. The note requires eight monthly payments of 
$&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;5,633&lt;/font&gt;, which include principal and interest. The final 
payment of the outstanding balance, including principal and interest, is due on 
November 24, 2016. This note is shown as other current assets.&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20" align="justify"&gt;The
Company will continue to lease certain of its facilities to SAB. We recorded 
rental income from the related party in the amounts of $&lt;font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;49,976&lt;/font&gt; and 
$&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;99,950&lt;/font&gt;, for the three and six months ended June 30, 2016, 
respectively.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Tronco 
Related Loans&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times
New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" 
align="justify"&gt;&lt;font style="COLOR: #231f20"&gt;In January 2014, we 
entered into a Note Purchase and Sale Agreement under which we agreed to 
purchase a loan made to Tronco Energy Corporation 
(&amp;#8220;Tronco&amp;#8221;), a party&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style="COLOR: 
#231f20"&gt;related to us through common control, in order to take over the 
legal position as Tronco&amp;#8217;s senior secured lender. That agreement 
provided that, upon our full repayment of the Tronco loan from the proceeds of 
the Offering, the lender would assign to us all of its rights under the Tronco 
loan, including all of the collateral documents. On May 30, 2014, we closed our 
purchase of the Tronco loan for a total payoff of $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;8.3&lt;/font&gt; million, 
including principal, interest, and early termination fees. As a result of that 
purchase, we became Tronco&amp;#8217;s senior secured lender, and as a result 
are entitled to receive all proceeds from sales of the Tronco-owned collateral, 
as discussed below.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20" align="justify"&gt;As 
the result of our purchase of the Tronco loan, we have the direct legal right to
enforce the collateral and guaranty agreements entered into in connection with 
the Tronco loan and to collect Tronco&amp;#8217;s collateral sales proceeds, in 
order to recover the loan purchase amount. The Tronco loan continues to be 
secured by the first position liens on all of Tronco assets, as well as by the 
guarantees of Troy and Annette Meier (the &amp;#8220;Meier 
Guaranties&amp;#8221;), which are directly payable to and legally enforceable by
us. In addition, the Meiers have provided us with stock pledges in which they 
pledge all of their shares of our common stock held by their family entities 
(the &amp;#8216;&amp;#8216;&lt;i&gt;Meier Stock 
Pledge&lt;/i&gt;&amp;#8217;&amp;#8217;), as collateral for the Meiers&amp;#8217;
guaranties until full repayment of Tronco loan. The certificates representing 
the &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;
8,814,860&lt;/font&gt; pledged shares are being held in third-party escrow until
full repayment of the Tronco loan. At a $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1.41&lt;/font&gt; per share price at closing
of the NYSE MKT on August 11, 2016, the pledged shares would currently have a 
market value of over $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;12.4&lt;/font&gt; million, significantly more than the 
amount necessary to repay the Tronco loan, even if no Tronco assets were 
sold.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both;
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px;
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20" 
align="justify"&gt;During July 2014, the Board of Directors agreed to 
restructure the Tronco loan effective May 29, 2014. As part of this 
restructuring the interest rate was decreased to the &lt;font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;prime rate&lt;/font&gt; 
of JPMorgan Chase Bank plus &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 0.25&lt;/font&gt;%, which was &lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 
3.75&lt;/font&gt;% as of March 31, 2016. The payment requirements and schedule 
were also changed with the restructuring. Only interest was due on December 31, 
2014, and a balloon payment of all unpaid interest and principal was due in full
at maturity on &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt"&gt;December 31, 2015&lt;/font&gt;. As of November 10, 2015, the 
Board of Directors agreed to extend the terms of the Tronco loan to interest 
only payments due on December 31, 2015 and 2016, with a balloon payment of all 
unpaid interest and principal due in full maturity on &lt;font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; December 31, 
2017&lt;/font&gt;. The Meiers made the December 31, 2015 interest payment by 
offsetting amounts due against their Founders notes.&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;table border="0" style="width:100%; table-layout:fixed;" 
cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;</us-
gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>

FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom; FONT-WEIGHT: 400" width="1%"&gt; 
&lt;div&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left;

&lt;div&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; 
FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; BACKGROUND: #ffffff; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom; FONT-WEIGHT: 400" width="10%"&gt; 
&lt;div&gt;N/A&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-

<us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy 
contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" id="Factid_360">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 
0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; 
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both"&gt; &lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 
0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt; &lt;b&gt;&lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;Share-Based Compensation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;The 
Company follows ASC 718, &lt;i&gt;Compensation- Stock Compensation&lt;/i&gt; 
(&amp;#8220;ASC 718&amp;#8221;), which requires the measurement and recognition 
of compensation expense for all share-based payment awards, including restricted
stock units, based on estimated grant date fair values. Restricted stock units 
are valued using the market price of our common shares on the date of grant. The
Company records compensation expense, net of estimated forfeitures, over the 
requisite service period.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.4in; MARGIN: 0in; FONT: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20" align="justify"&gt;On 
March 4, 2016, the Board of Directors granted options to acquire &lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 
78,944&lt;/font&gt; shares of stock from the Company&amp;#8217;s 2015 Long Term 
Incentive Plan to officers and employees based on the closing price of the 
Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of the grant, which was $&lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;1.73&lt;/font&gt;. These options vested &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 100&lt;/font&gt;% on the grant 
date and have a ten year term expiring on &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times
New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;March 4, 2026&lt;/font&gt;. The fair 
value of the vested stock options were calculated using the Black-Scholes model 
with a volatility and discount rate over the expected term of each 
employee.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-
INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR:
#231f20" align="justify"&gt;On March 18, 2016, the Board of Directors granted 
options to acquire &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 81,714&lt;/font&gt; shares of stock from the Company&amp;#8217;s
2015 Long Term Incentive Plan to officers and employees based on the closing 
price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of the grant, which 
was $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;1.67&lt;/font&gt;. These options vested &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 100&lt;/font&gt;% on the grant 
date and have a ten year term expiring on &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;March 18, 2026&lt;/font&gt;. The fair 
value of the vested stock options were calculated using the Black-Scholes model 
with a volatility and discount rate over the expected term of each 
employee.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-
INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR:
#231f20" align="justify"&gt;On March 31, 2016, the&amp;#160;Board of Directors 
granted options to acquire &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 148,475&lt;/font&gt; shares of stock from 
the Company&amp;#8217;s 2015 Long Term Incentive Plan to directors, officers and
employees based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on 
the date of the grant, which was $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1.37&lt;/font&gt;. These options vested 
&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 
100&lt;/font&gt;% on the grant date and have a ten year term expiring on 
&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;March 31, 2026&lt;/font&gt;. The fair value of the vested stock options
were calculated using the Black-Scholes model with a volatility and discount 
rate over the expected term of each employee.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;table

contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" id="Factid_373">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 
0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; 
FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: #231f20"&gt; &lt;strong&gt;NOTE 3. PROPERTY, 
PLANT AND EQUIPMENT&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-

<us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="P01_01_2016To06_30_2016" 
id="Factid_374">&lt;div style="MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif "&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-
SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; COLOR: 
#231f20"&gt; &lt;b&gt;&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; &lt;/font&gt;NOTE 9. SUBSEQUENT 
EVENTS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both"&gt; &amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt; 1. Bridge Financing&lt;/div&gt; 
&amp;#160; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 
10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif" align="justify"&gt;On August 5, 2016, we entered into a private 
transaction with a private investor&amp;#160;pursuant to which we issued a 
promissory note in the aggregate principal amounts of $&lt;font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1,000,000&lt;/font&gt; 
and a warrant to purchase up to an aggregate of &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 250,000&lt;/font&gt; shares of 
our common stock, subject to certain adjustments to the number of shares and the
exercise price described in the warrants (together, the &amp;#8220;Bridge 
Financing&amp;#8221;).&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times 
New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0pt 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" 
align="justify"&gt;The note matures on February 5, 2017, subject to our option 
to extend maturity for an additional three months, and accrue interest at the 
rate of &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;8&lt;/font&gt;% per annum. The note may be prepaid by us at any time, 
provided that we are required to pay a minimum of $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY:
'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;40,000&lt;/font&gt; of interest 
on the note at the time of prepayment. In the event that we fail to pay in full 
the indebtedness under the note on or before the maturity date, we are required 
to issue shares of our common stock in an aggregate amount representing &lt;font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 
200&lt;/font&gt;% of the principal amount of the note outstanding at the 
maturity date, based on a per share price equal to the 30-day volume weighted 
average trading price of the common stock on the NYSE MKT calculated as of the 
maturity date. Such penalty payment would be in replacement and satisfaction of 
the amounts then due and owed by us under the note. In the event that we 
complete a debt or equity financing, prior to the maturity date, we are required
to repay all amounts outstanding under the note. Until the payment in full of 
the indebtedness under the note, we also agreed not to grant, convey, create or 
impose any lien or security interest on any of our real or personal property 
other than liens existing on the date of the note.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;CLEAR: both" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;2. Amended Hard Rock Note&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;MARGIN: 0px; 
FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" 
align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-
FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0px; FONT: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;On August 10, 2016, 
certain of our subsidiaries entered into an amended and restated note with the 
seller in our acquisition of Hard Rock Solutions, LLC (as so amended and 
restated, the &amp;#8220;Hard Rock Note&amp;#8221;). As amended and restated 
effective August 10, 2016, the Hard Rock Note accrues interest at &lt;font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 
5.75&lt;/font&gt;% per annum and matures and is fully payable on January 15, 
2020. Under the current terms of Hard Rock Note, we are required to make the 
following payments: payments of $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1,500,000&lt;/font&gt; (plus accrued and 
unpaid interest) on or before October 15, 2016, accrued interest on each of 
January 15, March 15, May 15 and July 15, 2017, $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;500,000&lt;/font&gt; (plus 
accrued interest) on each of January 15, March 15, May 15 and July 15, 2018, and
$&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;1,000,000&lt;/font&gt; (plus accrued interest) on each of January 15, 
March 15, May 15 and July 15, 2019, with the remaining balance of principal and 
accrued interest on the Hard Rock Note due on &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;January 15, 
2020&lt;/font&gt;.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New 
Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; MARGIN: 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif" align="justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE: 10pt;TEXT-INDENT: 
0.5in; MARGIN: 0px; FONT: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif" 
align="justify"&gt;In connection with the amendment and restatement, we made an 
interest payment of approximately $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;304,000&lt;/font&gt; on the Hard Rock Note. 
In addition we issued &lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt; 700,000&lt;/font&gt; restricted shares of common stock 
(having an agreed per share value of $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1.43&lt;/font&gt;, or $&lt;font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1,000,000&lt;/font&gt; in
the aggregate) as payment for $1,000,000 of the $1,500,000 due on the Hard Rock 
Note on or before October 15, 2016, thereby reducing the principal from 
$&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"&gt;9,500,000&lt;/font&gt; to $&lt;font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;8,500,000&lt;/font&gt;. Interest will 
continue to accrue on the Hard Rock Note based on the $&lt;font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"&gt;1,000,000&lt;/font&gt; 
value of the shares until such shares are registered.&lt;/div&gt;

cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;</us-
gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>

&lt;/table&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times New Roman;FONT-SIZE:
10pt;CLEAR: both"&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="CLEAR:both; FONT-FAMILY:Times
